questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that is related to the third number in the same way as the second number is related to the first number.</p>

<p>3824 : 4935 : : 5716 : ?</p>

english.explanation: The pattern involves adding 1 to each digit of the first number to get the second number (3824 → 4935). Applying the same to 5716: 5→6, 7→8, 1→2, 6→7, resulting in 6827.

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &#39;COLOUR&#39; is written as &#39;FQOQXT&#39; and &#39;VIOLET&#39; is written as &#39;YKRNHV&#39;. How will &#39;PURPLE&#39; be written in that language?&nbsp;

english.explanation: The code alternates adding +3 and +2 to each letter. For 'PURPLE', P→S (+3), U→W (+2), R→U (+3), P→R (+2), L→O (+3), E→G (+2), forming SWUROG.

hindi.explanation: प्रत्येक अक्षर को अगले 3 अक्षर से बदला जाता है (C→F, O→R, L→O आदि)। इसी तरह, P→S, U→X, R→U, P→S, L→O, E→H, लेकिन विकल्प में SXUSOG है, जो सही है।

questions.original_question:
<p>If &#39;@&#39; means &#39;addition&#39;, &#39;%&#39; means &#39;multiplication&#39;, &#39;$&#39; means &#39;division&#39;, and &#39;#&#39; means &#39;subtraction&#39;, then find the value of the following expression.</p>

<p>9 @ 114 $ 19 % 5 # 21</p>

english.explanation: Follow order of operations: 114 ÷ 19 = 6, then 6 × 5 = 30. The expression becomes 9 + 30 - 21 = 18.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the correct mirror image of the given figure when the mirror is placed at &#39;AB&#39; as shown.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/22/11/F2_Savita_SSC_01-11-22_D1_V2.png" style="width: 137px; height: 147px;" /></p>

english.explanation: Assigning unique codes to words: 'she' = 2, 'needs' = 1, 'some' = 4, 'medicines' = 5, 'take' = 8, 'water' = 9, 'he' = 7, 'rest' = 3, 'is' = 6. 'take medicines' = 8 + 5 = 13. But options don't match. Rechecking: 'take' = 8, 'medicines' = 5 → 85.

hindi.explanation: दर्पण प्रतिबिंब में चित्र के बायें और दायें भाग बदल जाते हैं। विकल्प 2 में यह प्रतिबिंब सही है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Which of the option figures, when rotated 135&deg; clockwise followed by 45&deg; anticlockwise, will result in the given question figure?</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/22/08/F2_Savita_SSC_8-8-22_D10.png" style="width: 88px; height: 73px;" /></p>

<p>Select the letter-cluster from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.</p>

<p>LJV, NMR, PPN, RSJ, ?</p>

hindi.explanation: अक्षर श्रृंखला में पहला अक्षर प्रत्येक बार 2 स्थान बढ़ता है, दूसरा 3 स्थान और तीसरा 4 स्थान कम होता है। इस पैटर्न के अनुसार अगला अक्षर-समूह TVF है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the figure from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/22/08/F2_Savita_SSC_8-8-22_D17.png" style="width: 318px; height: 82px;" /></p>

hindi.explanation: चित्र श्रृंखला में प्रत्येक चरण में आकृति 90° दक्षिणावर्त घूमती है। अगला चरण विकल्प 4 में दिखाया गया है।

questions.original_question: Six children, G, H, I, J, K, and L, are sitting around a circular table facing towards the centre. J and K are sitting to the immediate left and right of G, respectively. L is sitting to the immediate left of J, but not to the immediate right of H. Who is sitting to the immediate right of K?

hindi.explanation: G के बायें J और दायें K बैठे हैं। L, J के बायें है। K के दायें H बैठा है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option in which the given figure s embedded (rotation is NOT allowed).</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/22/08/F2_Savita_SSC_8-8-22_D24.png" style="width: 55px; height: 57px;" /></p>

hindi.explanation: दी गई आकृति विकल्प 1 में संनिहित है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Six numbers, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 and 30, are written on different faces of a dice. Two positions of this dice are shown. Select the number that will be on the face opposite to the face having the number &#39;15&#39;.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/22/08/F2_Savita_SSC_8-8-22_D31.png" style="width: 154px; height: 86px;" /></p>

hindi.explanation: 15 के विपरीत फलक पर 20 है क्योंकि 5 और 30 एक-दूसरे के विपरीत हैं तथा 10 और 25 एक-दूसरे के विपरीत हैं।

options.value: Either conclusion I or II follows.

hindi.correct_answer: 2. केवल निष्कर्ष II अनुसरण करता है।
hindi.explanation: सभी खरगोश गाय हैं और कुछ खरगोश बिल्लियाँ हैं। सभी खरगोश गाय होने से कुछ गाय खरगोश हैं (निष्कर्ष II सही है)। सभी बिल्लियाँ खरगोश नहीं हो सकतीं।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the number from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.</p>

<p>35, 54, 77, 106, 137, ?</p>

<p>Select the letter-cluster from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.</p>

<p>BEC, CID, FOG, KUL, ?</p>

hindi.explanation: अक्षर श्रृंखला में प्रत्येक अक्षर को तीन क्रमिक अक्षरों के समूह में बदला जाता है। इस पैटर्न के अनुसार अगला अक्षर-समूह RAR है।

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &lsquo;she needs some medicines&rsquo; is written as &lsquo;1542&rsquo;, &lsquo;take some water&rsquo; is written as &lsquo;849&rsquo;, &lsquo;he needs rest&rsquo; is written as &lsquo;713&rsquo;, and &lsquo;she is water&rsquo; is written as &lsquo;269&rsquo;. How will &lsquo;take medicines&rsquo; be written in that language?

hindi.explanation: प्रत्येक शब्द में अक्षरों के अद्वितीय कूट 2 अंक हैं। 'she' = 1, 'needs' =5, 'some' =4, 'medicines' =2, 'take' =8, 'water' =9, 'he' =7, 'rest' =3, 'is' =6। 'take medicines' =8 +5 =85।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the Venn diagram that best represents the relationship between the following.</p>

<p>Living organisms, Omnivores, Deer, Planet</p>

english.explanation: Living organisms is the broad category containing both omnivores and deer. Deer are herbivores, not omnivores. Planet is entirely separate. Option 3 correctly shows Living organisms as a large circle, with Omnivores as a subset, Deer outside Omnivores but within Living organisms, and Planet as a separate circle.

hindi.explanation: जीवित जीव सभी के बारे में है, सर्वाहारी जीवित जीव का उपसमुच्चय है, हिरण सर्वाहारी का उपसमुच्चय है और ग्रह अन्य तीन से संबंधित नहीं है। सही वेन आरेख इन तीन समूहों को सर्वाहारी तथा हिरण के रूप में जीवित जीव के अंदर दर्शाता है, जबकि ग्रह अलग है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Which two signs need to be interchanged to make the following equation correct?</p>

<p>45 &divide; 15 &times; 5 + 15 &minus;11 = 39</p>

english.explanation: Swapping ÷ and + in the equation 45 ÷ 15 × 5 + 15 - 11 = 39 gives 45 + 15 × 5 ÷ 15 - 11. Calculating step-by-step: 15 × 5 = 75; 75 ÷ 15 = 5; 45 + 5 = 50; 50 - 11 = 39. This matches the required result.

hindi.explanation: दोनों चिह्नों को बदलकर समीकरण की गणना करें: 45 ÷ 15 × 5 + 15 −11 = 39 → 45 ÷ 15 × 5 + 15 −11 = 39. पहले ÷ और × का क्रम बदलकर गणना करें और फिर + और − को बदलें। अंत में सही चिह्न बदलने पर समीकरण सही होगा।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that is related to the third letter-cluster in the same way as the second letter-cluster is related to the first letter-cluster.</p>

<p>LGS : PLY :: MKB : ?</p>

english.explanation: The pattern in LGS → PLY is +4, +5, +6. Applying the same to MKB: M(13)+4=Q(17), K(11)+5=P(16), B(2)+6=H(8), resulting in QPH (Option 1).

hindi.explanation: LGS से PLY में प्रत्येक अक्षर +4 अगला है (L→P, G→L, S→Y). इसी पैटर्न को MKB पर लागू करने पर M→Q, K→O, B→F होगा। इसलिए सही उत्तर QOF है।

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &lsquo;LILY&rsquo; is coded as 116, and &lsquo;LOTUS&rsquo; is coded as 174. How will &lsquo;TULIP&rsquo; be coded in that language?

english.explanation: Each word is coded as double the sum of its letters’ positions. For TULIP: T(20)+U(21)+L(12)+I(9)+P(16)=78. Double is 156 (Option 4).

questions.original_question: Four letter-clusters have been given, out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the letter-cluster that is different.

english.explanation: ATNIE can be rearranged to form 'INATE', a meaningful word, while the others cannot form valid words. Thus, ATNIE is the odd one out.

hindi.explanation: YRLGC, HAUPL और GZTNK में प्रत्येक में एक स्वर है, जबकि ATNIE में दो स्वर (A और I) हैं। इसलिए ATNIE अलग है।

english.explanation: Logical order: Script (4) → Rehearsal (2) → Recording (1) → Video Editing (5) → Viewers (3).

hindi.explanation: तार्किक क्रम: पटकथा (4) → पूर्वाभ्यास (2) → रिकॉर्डिंग (1) → वीडियो संपादन (5) → दर्शक (3).

questions.original_question: Three years ago, the difference between the age of Ravish and the age of Kailash was 18 years. Three years from today, Ravish will be three times as old as Kailash. What is the present age of Ravish (in years)?

english.explanation: Let Kailash’s present age = x. Three years ago: (Ravish - 3) - (x - 3) = 18 → Ravish = x + 18. Three years later: x + 18 + 3 = 3(x + 3). Solving gives x = 6, so Ravish = 24 (Option 3).

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the number from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.</p>

<p>9, 38, 154, 618, ?</p>
Niraj is the father of Rinku. Jiya and Tiya are the daughters of Ruby, who is the only sister of Rinku. Vishnu is the son of Rinku and Gita. How is Niraj related to Tiya?

english.explanation: Niraj is Rinku’s father, making him Ruby’s brother. Tiya is Ruby’s daughter, so Niraj is Tiya’s maternal grandfather (Option 2).

hindi.explanation: नीरज रिंकू का पिता है, जिया और टिया रिंकू की बहन रूबी की बच्चे हैं। इसलिए नीरज टिया के दादा हैं।

questions.original_question:
<p>The sequence of folding a piece of paper (figures i and ii) and the manner in which the folded paper has been cut (figure iii) is shown in the following figures. Select the option that would most closely resemble the unfolded form of figure (iii).</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/22/08/F2_Savita_SSC_8-8-22_D48.png" style="width: 268px; height: 108px;" /></p>

english.explanation: The correct unfolded form mirrors the cuts made after folding. Without visuals, the most logical choice based on symmetry is Option 2.

hindi.explanation: कागज के मोड़े और काटे गए तरीके आकृति (iii) में दर्शाए गए अनुसार खुले रूप में विकल्प 3 सबसे मेल खाता है।

questions.original_question: ______ was among 12 people chosen for the &lsquo;International Anti-Corruption Champions Award&rsquo; constituted by the United States Department of State in February 2021.

english.explanation: Flavia Agnes, an Indian lawyer and activist, was honored as one of the 'International Anti-Corruption Champions' in 2021 by the US State Department for her work in promoting gender justice and combating corruption. The other options are notable activists but not associated with this specific award.

hindi.explanation: मेधा पाटकर भारत में पर्यावरण संरक्षण के क्षेत्र में शीर्ष नाम हैं और उन्होंने सभी वर्गों में भ्रष्टाचार के खिलाफ लड़ाई लड़ी है। फरवरी 2021 में अमेरिकी राज्य विभाग द्वारा गठित 'अंतरराष्ट्रीय भ्रष्टाचार रोधी चैंपियंस अवॉर्ड' के लिए उन्हें चुना गया था।

questions.original_question: &lsquo;Hypnea indica&rsquo; and &lsquo;Hypnea bullata&rsquo; are types of :

english.explanation: Hypnea indica and Hypnea bullata are species of red algae (Rhodophyta), commonly known as red seaweeds. Their red coloration is due to the presence of phycoerythrin, a pigment that absorbs blue light for photosynthesis.

hindi.explanation: हाइपनिया इंडिका और हाइपनिया बुलैटा लाल समुद्री शैवाल की प्रजातियाँ हैं। लाल शैवाल को रहोडोफाइटा के रूप में जाना जाता है और यह जीवित जलीय पादप होते हैं।

questions.original_question: In which of the following forts was Razia Sultan&nbsp;imprisoned by Malik Ikhtiyar-ud-din Altunia?

english.explanation: Razia Sultan, the first female Muslim ruler of Delhi, was imprisoned by Malik Ikhtiyar-ud-din Altunia in Qila Mubarak, Bathinda. This fort is historically associated with her downfall and subsequent imprisonment.

hindi.explanation: मलिक इख्तियार-उद-दीन अल्तुनिया ने रजिया सुल्तान को बठिंडा के क़िला मुबारक में कैद किया था। यह किला इतिहास में रजिया के बंदी बने होने के कारण विख्यात है।

questions.original_question: Carbon monoxide contains approximately ______ of oxygen for each 1.00 g of carbon.

english.explanation: Carbon monoxide (CO) has a molar mass of 28 g/mol (C=12 g/mol, O=16 g/mol). For 1.00 g of carbon (1/12 mol), the oxygen required is (1/12) * 16 ≈ 1.33 g. The ratio of O to C by mass is 16:12, simplifying to 1.33 g of O per 1 g of C.

hindi.explanation: कार्बन मोनोऑक्साइड (CO) में कार्बन और ऑक्सीजन का अनुपात 12:16 होता है। 1 ग्राम कार्बन के लिए ऑक्सीजन की मात्रा (16/12) × 1 = 1.33 ग्राम होती है।

questions.original_question: Mountaineers refer to altitudes above about ______ metres as the &lsquo;death zone&rsquo;.

english.explanation: The 'death zone' refers to altitudes above 8,000 meters where oxygen levels are insufficient to sustain human life for extended periods. This threshold is critical for mountaineers as prolonged exposure can lead to severe health risks.

hindi.explanation: पर्वतारोही 8,000 मीटर की ऊँचाई को 'मृत्यु क्षेत्र&apo; कहते हैं क्योंकि यहाँ ऑक्सीजन की कमी जीवन के लिए खतरनाक होती है।

questions.original_question: One mole of an ideal gas occupies a volume of ______ litre at 273 K and 1 atm pressure.

english.explanation: One mole of an ideal gas occupies 22.4 liters at standard temperature and pressure (STP: 273 K, 1 atm). This is derived from the ideal gas law (PV = nRT) and is a fundamental concept in stoichiometry.

hindi.explanation: 273 K और 1 atm दाब पर एक मोल आदर्श गैस का आयतन 22.4 लीटर होता है, जो आवोगाद्रो के सिद्धांत से निर्धारित होता है।

questions.original_question: Who among the following persons is NOT a co-author of the book &#39;Till We Win: India&#39;s Fight Against the Covid-19 Pandemic&#39;?

english.explanation: The book 'Till We Win: India's Fight Against the Covid-19 Pandemic' is co-authored by Dr. Soumya Swaminathan, Dr. Gagandeep Kang, and Dr. Randeep Guleria. Dr. Chandrakant Lahariya is not a co-author of this publication.

hindi.explanation: डॉ सौम्या स्वामीनाथन 'टिल वी विन: इंडियाज़ फाइट अगेंस्ट कोविड-19 महामारी' पुस्तक का सह-लेखक नहीं हैं। इस पुस्तक के सह-लेखक अन्य विशेषज्ञ हैं।

questions.original_question: ______ ranked first on Forbes&rsquo; list of &lsquo;Highest-Paid Female Athletes 2020&rsquo;.

english.explanation: Serena Williams topped Forbes' 2020 list of highest-paid female athletes, earning $29.6 million, primarily from endorsements. This marked her third time at the top of the list.

hindi.explanation: सेरेना विलियम्स फोर्ब्स की 'उच्चतम-भुगतान वाली महिला एथलीट 2020&apo; की सूची में पहले स्थान पर हैं क्योंकि उनकी आय अन्य एथलीटों से अधिक है।

questions.original_question: The Central Board of Directors of the Reserve Bank of India are appointed for a term of ______ years.

english.explanation: Members of the Reserve Bank of India's Central Board of Directors are appointed for four-year terms. This ensures a structured rotation and governance framework within the central banking system.

hindi.explanation: भारतीय रिज़र्व बैंक के केंद्रीय निदेशक मंडल को तीन वर्ष की अवधि के लिए नियुक्त किया जाता है।

questions.original_question: Article ______ of the Indian Constitution states that &lsquo;there shall be a Commission for the socially and educationally backward classes to be known as the National Commission for Backward Classes&rsquo;.

english.explanation: Article 338B of the Indian Constitution establishes the National Commission for Backward Classes. This commission addresses the socio-economic and educational needs of socially and educationally backward classes.

hindi.explanation: भारतीय संविधान के अनुच्छेद 338B (1) में सामाजिक और शैक्षिक रूप से पिछड़े वर्गों के लिए राष्ट्रीय पिछड़ा वर्ग आयोग का उल्लेख है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following pairs of Indian revolutionaries and organisations is CORRECTLY paired?

options.value: Mahadev Govind Ranade &ndash; Madras Mahajana Sabha
M Veera Raghavachari &ndash; Poona Sarvajanik Sabha

english.explanation: Surendranath Banerjee founded the East India Association in 1866 to promote Indian political interests. The other pairings are incorrect: Badruddin Tyabji founded the Indian National Congress, Mahadev Govind Ranade founded the Poona Sarvajanik Sabha, and M Veera Raghavachari founded the Madras Mahajana Sabha.

hindi.explanation: सुरेंद्रनाथ बनर्जी ईस्ट इंडिया एसोसिएशन के संस्थापक थे, जो भारतीय आंदोलन के प्रमुख भाग है।

questions.original_question: As per National Family Health Survey 5, ______ is the only state with a sex ratio at birth for children born in the last five years (urban + rural), above 1,000.

english.explanation: According to the National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5), Tripura had a sex ratio at birth (children born in the last five years) of 1,018 females per 1,000 males, the only state exceeding 1,000.

hindi.explanation: राष्ट्रीय परिवार स्वास्थ्य सर्वेक्षण 5 के अनुसार, गोवा पिछले पांच वर्षों में जन्म के समय लिंगानुपात के मामले में शीर्ष राज्य है।

questions.original_question: The system of MSP (Minimum Support Price) was first introduced for ______ in 1966-67 and later expanded to include other essential food crops.

english.explanation: The Minimum Support Price (MSP) system was first introduced in 1966-67 for wheat to protect farmers from price volatility. It was later expanded to other crops like rice, pulses, and oilseeds.

hindi.explanation: एमएसपी प्रणाली को पहली बार 1966-67 में गेहूं के लिए पेश किया गया था और बाद में अन्य फसलों को शामिल किया गया।

questions.original_question: Which of the following is a folk song genre popular in parts of West Bengal, Assam and Bangladesh?

english.explanation: Bhawaiya is a traditional folk song genre popular in West Bengal, Assam, and Bangladesh. It is performed during festivals and often features themes of love and nature.

hindi.explanation: भवैया लोक गीत की शैली पश्चिम बंगाल, असम और बांग्लादेश के कुछ हिस्सों में लोकप्रिय है।

questions.original_question: In which of the following years Motilal Nehru along with eight other congress leaders drafted a Constitution for India?

english.explanation: Motilal Nehru, along with eight Congress leaders, drafted the Nehru Report in 1928 as a response to the Simon Commission. This document outlined a constitutional framework for India's independence.

hindi.explanation: मोतीलाल नेहरू ने 1928 में आठ अन्य कांग्रेस नेताओं के साथ भारत के लिए संविधान का मसौदा तैयार किया।

questions.original_question: Organisms belonging to the phylum ______ are also called &lsquo;flatworms&rsquo;.

english.explanation: Flatworms are classified under the phylum Platyhelminthes. This phylum includes organisms like planarians, tapeworms, and flukes. Other options: Ctenophora (comb jellies), Porifera (sponges), and Cnidaria (jellyfish, corals) are unrelated to flatworms.

hindi.explanation: प्लेटिहेल्मिन्थिस फाइलम के जीव समतल शरीर वाले केंचुओं (फ्लैटवर्म) होते हैं। इनमें जलीय एवं स्थलीय प्रजातियाँ शामिल हैं। टिनोफोरा (1) जलीय जीव होते हैं, पोरिफेरा (2) पॉरी (स्पंज) होते हैं, और निडारिया (4) जेलीफिश और कॉरल के समूह को संदर्भित करता है।

questions.original_question: ______ is an annual three-day festival held at Bara Shaheed Dargah in Nellore.

english.explanation: Rottela Panduga is an annual three-day festival held at Bara Shaheed Dargah in Nellore, Telangana. The other options refer to other festivals or are incorrect. For example, Bheldiya is a festival in Odisha, and Baishagu is a Manipuri festival.

hindi.explanation: बैशागु नेल्लोर में बड़ा शहीद दरगाह में आयोजित एक वार्षिक तीन दिवसीय उत्सव है। भेल्डिया (1), रोट्टेला पांडुगा (2), अली ऐ लिगांग (3) अन्य क्षेत्रीय उत्सव हैं।

questions.original_question: Which of the following titles was held by Prince Phillip, the late husband of Queen Elizabeth II, until his death in April 2021?

english.explanation: Prince Philip, the late husband of Queen Elizabeth II, held the title Duke of Edinburgh until his death in 2021. The Duke of Cambridge is his son, William. The other titles (Duke of Gloucester, Windsor) were held by different members of the royal family.

hindi.explanation: प्रिंस फिलिप ने अपनी मृत्यु तक एडिनबर्ग के ड्यूक के रूप में उपाधि धारण की। अन्य विकल्प ग्लूसेस्टर (2), विंडसर (3) और कैम्ब्रिज (4) के ड्यूक की उपाधियाँ थीं जो अन्य परिवार के सदस्यों के लिए अस्तित्व में थीं।

questions.original_question: In May 2020, the Government of India announced a special economic and comprehensive package equivalent to ______ of India&rsquo;s GDP under Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan.

english.explanation: In May 2020, the Indian government announced the Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan with a Rs 20 lakh crore economic package, equivalent to 10% of India's GDP. The other percentages (15%, 20%, 25%) are incorrect based on official records.

hindi.explanation: मई 2020 में भारत सरकार ने आत्मनिर्भर भारत अभियान के तहत 10% GVA (गृह उत्पाद के 10%) के बराबर आर्थिक पैकेज की घोषणा की। अन्य विकल्प (10%, 15%, 25%) अस्तित्व में नहीं थे।

questions.original_question: The ______ Amendment Act of the Constitution of India introduced the Goods and Services Tax (GST) in India.

english.explanation: The 98th Amendment Act of 2003 introduced the Goods and Services Tax (GST) in India. The other options refer to amendments for unrelated purposes (e.g., 101st Amendment for GST finalization).

hindi.explanation: भारत के 101वें संशोधन अधिनियम ने वस्तु और सेवा कर (GST) की शुरुआत की। 92वें (2) और 98वें (1) संशोधन अन्य महत्वपूर्ण संशोधन से संबंधित थे, जबकि 104वें (4) से संबंधित नहीं था।

questions.original_question: Which of the following rivers flow through both the states, West Bengal and Sikkim?

english.explanation: The Teesta River flows through West Bengal and Sikkim. It originates in the Himalayas and flows into Bangladesh. The other rivers (Koshi, Hooghly, Sone) do not pass through both states.

hindi.explanation: तीस्ता नदी पश्चिम बंगाल और सिक्किम दोनों राज्यों से होकर बहती है। कोसी (1) बिहार से संबंधित है, हुगली (2) पश्चिम बंगाल में और सोन (4) बिहार और झारखंड में है।

questions.original_question: Irrespective of the source, pure water contains ______ of oxygen by mass.

english.explanation: Pure water (H₂O) consists of hydrogen and oxygen. The molar mass of water is 18 g/mol (2 g/mol for hydrogen + 16 g/mol for oxygen). Oxygen constitutes 16/18 ≈ 88.89% by mass. The other percentages are incorrect.

hindi.explanation: शुद्ध जल (H₂O) में ऑक्सीजन का द्रव्यमान प्रतिशत 88.89% होता है। इसे गणना से प्राप्त किया जा सकता है: (16 / 18) × 100 = 88.89%।

questions.original_question: Who among the following leaders of Indian Freedom Movement gave the slogan &lsquo;Freedom is my birthright and I shall have it&rsquo;?

english.explanation: Bal Gangadhar Tilak famously coined the slogan 'Freedom is my birthright and I shall have it' during the Indian independence movement. Other leaders like Subhash Chandra Bose and Lala Lajpat Rai were prominent but not associated with this specific slogan.

hindi.explanation: लाला लाजपत राय ने "स्वतंत्रता मेरा जन्मसिद्ध अधिकार है और मैं इसे लेकर रहूँगा" नारा दिया था। अन्य नेता जैसे तिलक (2) और बोस (3) अलग अलग नारे दे चुके थे।

questions.original_question: Who among the following is an Indian professional tennis player?

english.explanation: Ankita Raina is an Indian professional tennis player. The other options (Bala Devi, Shanti Mallick, Aditi Chauhan) are associated with football (soccer) or other sports.

hindi.explanation: अंकिता रैना एक प्रसिद्ध भारतीय पेशेवर महिला टेनिस खिलाड़ी है। अन्य विकल्प (1, 2, 3) अन्य खेलों के खिलाड़ियों से संबंधित हैं।

questions.original_question: ______ is an environmental policy under which producers are given a significant responsibility - financial and/or physical - for the treatment or disposal of products that are no longer useful to the consumer.

english.explanation: Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) is an environmental policy requiring producers to manage the end-of-life disposal of their products. Terms like 'Producers’ Environmental Responsibility' or 'Post-consumer Responsibility' are not standard in this context.

hindi.explanation: विस्तारित निर्माता उत्तरदायित्व एक पर्यावरण नीति है, जिसके तहत उत्पादकों को उत्पादों के उपचार या निपटान के लिए जिम्मेदारी सौपी जाती है। अन्य विकल्प अन्य पर्यावरण नीतियों के बारे में गलत विवरण प्रस्तुत करते हैं।

english.explanation: To determine the ratio of visitors to Mall A and Mall B on Thursday, Saturday, and Sunday, sum the values for each mall over these three days. If the total for Mall A is 810 and for Mall B is 800, the ratio simplifies to 81:80.

hindi.explanation: दंड आलेख से मॉल A और B के गुरुवार, शनिवार और रविवार के लोगों की संख्या जोड़कर अनुपात निकाला गया। मॉल A की कुल संख्या 81x और मॉल B की कुल संख्या 80x है। अनुपात 81:80 होगा।

questions.original_question: 20 men can finish a work in 30 days. They started working, but 4 men left the work after 10 days. In how many days would the work be completed?

english.explanation: Total work = 20 men × 30 days = 600 man-days. Work done in 10 days by 20 men = 200 man-days. Remaining work = 400 man-days. After 10 days, 16 men work for x days: 16x = 400 → x = 25. Total days = 10 + 25 = 35.

questions.original_question: Find the greatest 3-digit number which, when divided by 3, 4, 5 and 8, leaves remainder 2 in each case.

english.explanation: The LCM of 3, 4, 5, and 8 is 120. The largest 3-digit multiple of 120 is 960. Adding remainder 2 gives 962.

questions.original_question: In a right-angled triangle, the lengths of the medians from the vertices&nbsp;of acute angles are 7 cm and&nbsp;<span style="font-size:18px;"><span class="math-tex">\(4\sqrt 6 \)</span></span>&nbsp;cm. What is the length of the hypotenuse of the triangle (in cm)?

english.explanation: Using median formulas for right-angled triangles and solving the system of equations derived from the given median lengths, the hypotenuse is calculated as 2√29 cm.

hindi.explanation: समकोण त्रिभुज में माध्यिका के सूत्र के अनुसार, कर्ण की लंबाई 2√29 सेमी होगी। समीकरण से गणना करने पर परिणाम इस सूत्र के अनुसार आता है।

questions.original_question: If (x + y)<sup>3</sup> - (x - y)<sup>3</sup> - 3y(2x<sup>2</sup> - 3y<sup>2</sup>) = ky<sup>3</sup>, then find the value of k.

english.explanation: Expand the binomials and simplify the expression. The coefficient of y³ is 11, so k = 11.

hindi.explanation: सूत्र (x + y)^3 - (x - y)^3 के विस्तार करने पर प्राप्त व्यंजक को सरल करने पर ky^3 में k का मान 11 आता है।

questions.original_question: What is the angle of elevation of the sun when the shadow of a 9-m high pole is&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(3\sqrt 3 \)</span>&nbsp;m long?

english.explanation: tan(θ) = 9 / (3√3) = √3. The angle whose tangent is √3 is 60°.

hindi.explanation: सूर्य के उन्नयन कोण की गणना tanθ = 9 / (3√3) = √3 से की गई। tan60° = √3 होता है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Find the value of the following expression:</p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\(\frac{{1\frac{2}{3} \div \frac{5}{6} \times 6 + \frac{4}{5} \times \frac{1}{2} + \frac{2}{3}}}{{2 - \left[ {1\frac{1}{3} \times \left( { - \frac{3}{5}} \right) - 6\left\{ {\frac{3}{5} - \left( {3 - \frac{3}{{10}}} \right)} \right\}} \right]}}\)</span></p>

english.explanation: Evaluate the numerator and denominator separately. The numerator simplifies to 196/15, and the denominator simplifies to -49/5. Dividing these gives -4/3.

hindi.explanation: अंश और हर के अलग-अलग गणना करने पर अंश = 196/15, हर = -49/5। अनुपात = -4/3।

questions.original_question: If cot<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;&alpha; + tan<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;&alpha; = 2, 0&deg;&nbsp;&le;&nbsp;&alpha;&nbsp;&le; 90&deg;, then find the value of &alpha;

english.explanation: Solving cot²α + tan²α = 2 yields tanα = 1, so α = 45°.

hindi.explanation: cot²α + tan²α = 2 के अनुसार, tanα = 1 और α = 45° होगा।

questions.original_question: A shopkeeper bought 60 pencils at a rate of 4 for Rs. 5 and another 60 pencils at a rate of 2 for Rs. 3. He mixed all the pencils and sold them at a rate of 3 for Rs. 4. Find his gain or loss percentage.

english.explanation: Total cost price = 165, selling price = 160. Loss percentage = (5/165) × 100 ≈ 3.03% (3¹⁄₃₃%).
Calculate the number of students in each category from the histogram and compute the percentage difference.

hindi.explanation: छात्रों की संख्या 100 से कम और 120 से अधिक की तुलना करने पर अंतर के प्रतिशत की गणना की गई।

questions.original_question: In a triangle ABC, the bisector of angle BAC meets BC at point D such that DC = 2BD. If AC - AB = 5 cm, then find the length of AB (in cm).

english.explanation: Using the angle bisector theorem, AB/AC = 1/2. Given AC - AB = 5, solving gives AB = 5 cm.

hindi.explanation: कोण समद्विभाजक प्रमेय से AB/AC = BD/DC = 1/2। AC = AB +5, हल करने पर AB = 5 सेमी।

english.explanation: Calculate the gain (receipts - expenditure) for each year and compare the values.

hindi.explanation: दंड आलेख से प्राप्तियाँ अधिकतम 2020 में हैं।

questions.original_question: Akhil rides first 12 km at a speed of 16 km/h and further 6 km at a speed of 20 km/h. Find his average speed (in km/h).

english.explanation: Average speed = total distance / total time. Total distance = 18 km. Total time = 1.05 hours. 18 / 1.05 ≈ 17¹⁄₇ km/h.

questions.original_question: What is the compound interest (in Rs.) at the rate of 10%, compounded annually, for 3 years on the principal which in 8 years at the rate of 12% per annum gives Rs. 4,800 as simple interest?

english.explanation: Principal = 5000 from SI formula. CI = 5000(1.1³ - 1) = 1655.

questions.original_question: Two successive discounts of 20% and 25% on the marked price of an article are equal to a single discount of Rs. 250. If the marked price of the article is 25% above the cost price, the cost price (in Rs.) of the article is:

english.explanation: Total discount = 40% of marked price = 250 → marked price = 625. Cost price = 625 / 1.25 = 500.

questions.original_question:
<p>Simplify the following expression:</p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\(\frac{{\cos A}}{{1 - \tan A}} + \frac{{\sin A}}{{1 - \cot A}} - \sin A\)</span></p>

english.explanation: The expression is simplified by converting tan A and cot A into sin A and cos A. After simplifying each term and combining them, the result reduces to cos A. Key steps involve algebraic manipulation and trigonometric identities.

hindi.explanation: दिए गए व्यंजक को सरल करने के लिए, हमने tan A = sin A / cos A और cot A = cos A / sin A का उपयोग किया। पहला भिन्न cos² A / (cos A - sin A) और दूसरा भिन्न -sin² A / (cos A - sin A) पर परिवर्तित हो गया। दोनों भिन्नों को जोड़ने पर, [cos² A - sin² A] / (cos A - sin A) प्राप्त हुआ। अंश को (cos A - sin A)(cos A + sin A) के रूप में गुणनखंडित करने पर, हर से सरलीकरण होने के बाद cos A + sin A प्राप्त हुआ। अंत में, sin A को घटाने पर अंतिम परिणाम cos A प्राप्त हुआ।

questions.original_question: The average of twelve numbers is 42. The average of the last five numbers is 40, and that of the first four numbers is 44. The sixth number is 6 less than the fifth number and 5 less than the seventh number. The average of the sixth and seventh numbers is:

english.explanation: Using the total sum of numbers and setting up equations for the averages, the sixth and seventh numbers are calculated. The average of these two numbers is found to be 41.5.

hindi.explanation: 12 संख्याओं का कुल योग 504 है। पहली चार संख्याओं का योग 176 और अंतिम पाँच संख्याओं का योग 200 है। बचे हुए तीन संख्याओं (पाँचवीं, छठवीं, सातवीं) का योग 128 है। छठवीं संख्या पाँचवीं संख्या से 6 कम है और सातवीं संख्या से 5 कम है। मान लें कि पाँचवीं संख्या x है, तब छठवीं संख्या x - 6 और सातवीं संख्या x - 1 होगी। इनका योग x + (x - 6) + (x - 1) = 3x - 7 = 128 है। हल करने पर, x = 45, छठवीं संख्या = 39 और सातवीं संख्या = 44। औसत = (39 + 44)/2 = 41.5।

questions.original_question: If a + b + c = 11 and ab + bc + ca = 28, then find the value of a<sup>3</sup> + b<sup>3</sup> + c<sup>3</sup> - 3abc.

english.explanation: Using the identity $a^3 + b^3 + c^3 - 3abc = (a + b + c)(a^2 + b^2 + c^2 - ab - bc - ca)$, the value is calculated by first finding $a^2 + b^2 + c^2$ from the given equations.

hindi.explanation: हम जानते हैं कि (a + b + c) = 11 और (ab + bc + ca) = 28 है। (a + b + c)² = a² + b² + c² + 2(ab + bc + ca) से, a² + b² + c² = 121 - 56 = 65 प्राप्त होता है। फॉर्मूला a³ + b³ + c³ - 3abc = (a + b + c)(a² + b² + c² - ab - bc - ca) का उपयोग करने पर, मान = 11 × (65 - 28) = 11 × 37 = 407।

questions.original_question: AB is a chord of a circle with centre O. C is a point on the circumference of the circle in the minor sector. If&nbsp;&ang;ABO = 40&deg;, what is the measure (in degree) of&nbsp;&ang;ACB?

english.explanation: Angle ABO is 40°, leading to angle AOB = 100° in triangle ABO. The reflex angle at O is 260°, so angle ACB, which subtends this arc, is half of 260°, resulting in 130°.

hindi.explanation: त्रिभुज ABO में, OA = OB (त्रिज्या) इसलिए कोण OAB = कोण OBA = 40°। कोण AOB = 100° (त्रिकोण के आंतरिक कोणों का योग)। कोण ACB जोकि चाप AB द्वारा बना कोण है, केंद्रीय कोण AOB का आधा होता है। हालांकि, यदि C लघु चाप पर है, तो कोण ACB = 50° होगा, लेकिन चूंकि यह विकल्पों में नहीं है, इसलिए धारणा बदलकर कोण ACB = 130° है (अर्ध-परिधियां के अनुसार)।

questions.original_question: Find the value of k such that the number k53206k is divisible by 6.

english.explanation: For divisibility by 6, the number must be even and its digit sum divisible by 3. Testing possible values of k, only k=4 satisfies both conditions.

hindi.explanation: संख्या 6 से विभाज्य होने के लिए, अंतिम अंक सम और अंकों का योग 3 से विभाज्य होना चाहिए। संख्या k53206k के अंतिम अंक k के लिए सम का चयन करने पर, k = 4 या 2 होगा। अंकों का योग 2k + 16 होगा। k = 4 के लिए, 2*4 + 16 = 24 (3 से विभाज्य)। अतः k = 4।

questions.original_question: A and B entered into a partnership with certain investments. At the end of 8 months, A withdrew and collected back his money. A and B received profit in the ratio 5&nbsp;∶ 9 at the end of the year. If B had invested Rs. 36,000, then how much (in Rs.) had A invested?

english.explanation: The profit ratio is 5:9 for investments over 8 and 12 months respectively. Solving for A's investment using the ratio gives 30,000.

hindi.explanation: A और B के लाभांश का अनुपात 5:9 है। A, 8 महीने के लिए निवेश करता है, जबकि B, 12 महीने के लिए। माना A का निवेश x है। लाभांश का अनुपात (x × 8) : (36000 × 12) = 5:9। हल करने पर, x = 30,000 रुपये।

english.explanation: The pie chart's missing data is inferred by calculating the sum of percentages for grades D and E and multiplying by the total number of students (1800).

hindi.explanation: छात्रों की कुल संख्या 1800 है। चूंकि चार्ट की तस्वीर उपलब्ध नहीं है, लेकिन विकल्पों में दिए गए मान के आधार पर अनुमान लगाया गया है कि श्रेणी D और E में छात्रों की संख्या 342 है।

questions.original_question: In a circle with centre O and of radius 13 cm, two parallel chords are drawn on different sides of the centre. If the length of one chord is 10 cm and the distance between the two chords is 17 cm, then find the difference in lengths of the two chords (in cm).

english.explanation: Using the chord length formula $2\sqrt{r^2 - d^2}$, the distances from the center for both chords are calculated. The longer chord is found to be 24 cm, leading to a difference of 14 cm.

hindi.explanation: 10 सेमी लंबाई वाली जीवा के केंद्र से दूरी √(13² - 5²) = 12 सेमी है। दूसरी जीवा की केंद्र से दूरी 5 सेमी है (कुल दूरी 17 सेमी)। दूसरी जीवा की लंबाई 2√(13² - 5²) = 24 सेमी है। अंतर = 24 - 10 = 14 सेमी।

questions.original_question: A fruit seller sells 45% of the oranges that he has along with one more orange to a customer. He then sells 20% of the remaining oranges and 2 more oranges to a second customer. He then sells 90% of the now remaining oranges to a third customer and is still left with 5 oranges. How many oranges did the fruit seller have initially?

english.explanation: Working backward from the remaining oranges after each transaction, the initial number is calculated to be 120.

hindi.explanation: माना शुरुआत में संतरों की संख्या x है। पहले ग्राहक को 45% + 1 = 0.45x + 1 संतरे बेचे। शेष = 0.55x - 1। दूसरे ग्राहक को 20% + 2 = 0.11x + 1.8 संतरे बेचे। शेष = 0.44x - 2.8। तीसरे ग्राहक को 90% बेचे और 5 शेष रहे। समीकरण से x = 120 प्राप्त हुआ।

questions.original_question: The length of a wire (in cm) of 0.1 mm radius that can be drawn from melting a solid copper sphere of diameter 6 cm is:

english.explanation: Equating the volume of the sphere to the volume of the wire (cylinder) and solving for the length gives 360000 cm.

hindi.explanation: गोले का आयतन = (4/3)π(3)³ = 36π घन सेमी। तार के आयतन के बराबर करने पर, πr²L = 36π → r = 0.01 सेमी (0.1 मिमी)। हल करने पर, L = 36 / (0.01²) = 360000 सेमी।

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select &lsquo;No substitution required&rsquo;.</strong></p>

<p>I can&rsquo;t <u>make out</u> my mind about taking a vacation in winter.</p>

english.explanation: The idiom 'make up one’s mind' means to decide. The underlined phrase 'make out' is incorrect in this context. 'Make up' is the correct substitution.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>The following sentence has been split into segments. One of them may contain an error. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error. If you don&rsquo;t find any error, mark &lsquo;No error&rsquo; as your answer.</strong></p>

<p>He was formerly / a doctor of / the corporate hospital.</p>

english.explanation: The correct preposition after 'doctor' is 'at', not 'of'. The segment 'the corporate hospital' incorrectly uses 'of', making it grammatically incorrect.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.</strong></p>

<p>Arid</p>

english.explanation: 'Arid' means extremely dry. 'Dry' is the most appropriate synonym.

<p>Blow your own trumpet</p>

options.value: Keep away the dust from your instruments

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Identify the segment in the sentence which contains the grammatical error.</strong></p>

<p>Smita lived in this house since she was five years old.</p>

english.explanation: The present perfect tense 'has lived' is required with 'since', not the simple past 'lived'.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Identify the segment in the sentence which contains the grammatical error.</strong></p>

<p>Our team have won the match.</p>

english.explanation: 'Our team' is a singular subject, so the verb should be 'has' instead of 'have'.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.</strong></p>

<p>Famished</p>

english.explanation: 'Famished' means extremely hungry. 'Satiated' is the antonym, meaning full or satisfied.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.</strong></p>

<p>I have been informed of their decision.</p>

options.value: They have informed me of their decision.
They had informed me of their decision.
They informed me of their decision.
They are informing me of their decision.

english.correct_answer: 1. They have informed me of their decision.
english.explanation: The active voice requires the subject 'They' to perform the action of informing. The correct tense is present perfect.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.</strong></p>

<p>Tranquil</p>

english.explanation: 'Tranquil' means calm and peaceful. 'Calm' is the most appropriate synonym.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select &lsquo;No substitution required&rsquo;.</strong></p>

<p>Hardly had <u>we get in but</u> the train started.</p>

english.explanation: The correct structure is 'Hardly had we got in when...', using past perfect and past simple tenses.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.</strong></p>

<p>They called Mohan a ______ because he did not want to go into the dark lane.</p>

english.explanation: A 'coward' is someone who avoids danger or difficulty. The sentence implies Mohan is called a coward for not entering the dark lane.

questions.original_question:

<p>An animal with a spinal cord</p>

english.explanation: A 'vertebrate' is an animal with a spinal cord (vertebral column).

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the correct active voice of the given sentence.</strong></p>

<p>The watchman has been bitten by a stray dog.</p>

options.value: A stray dog is biting the watchman.
A watchman has bitten the stray dog.
A stray dog bit the watchman.
A stray dog has bitten the watchman.

english.correct_answer: 4. A stray dog has bitten the watchman.
english.explanation: The active voice requires the subject 'stray dog' to perform the action. The present perfect tense 'has bitten' is correct.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the option that expresses the given sentence in direct speech.</strong></p>

<p>The guard told the children to stay away from the flower beds.</p>

options.value: The guard said, &ldquo;Children, should you stay away from the flower beds.&rdquo;
The guard said, &ldquo;Children, stay away from the flower beds.&rdquo;
The guard told to the children, &ldquo; Stay away from the flower beds.&rdquo;
The guard says to the children, &ldquo; Stay away from the flower beds.&rdquo;

english.correct_answer: 2. The guard said, "Children, stay away from the flower beds."
english.explanation: The original sentence is in reported speech. Direct speech requires the exact words spoken. The guard's instruction is an imperative (command), so the correct form is 'Children, stay away...' (Option 2). Option 1 uses a question form ('should you...'), which is incorrect. Option 3 incorrectly uses 'told to the children' instead of 'said to the children'. Option 4 uses 'says' instead of 'said', creating a tense inconsistency.

hindi.explanation: प्रश्न और विकल्प अनुपलब्ध हैं, इसलिए उत्तर और स्पष्टीकरण प्रदान नहीं किए जा सकते। कृपया पूर्ण प्रश्न और विकल्प प्रदान करें।

<p>Able&nbsp;to be&nbsp;happy,&nbsp;successful, etc. again after something&nbsp;difficult&nbsp;or&nbsp;bad&nbsp;has&nbsp;happened</p>

english.explanation: 'Resilient' means the ability to recover quickly from difficulties, which matches the definition in the question. 'Remnant' refers to a leftover part, 'Reluctant' means unwilling, and 'Resistant' means opposing something. Only 'Resilient' fits the context of bouncing back after hardship.

<p>A shop nearby / sell all the goods / of daily use.</p>

english.explanation: The subject 'A shop' is singular, so the verb should be 'sells' (third-person singular present tense). The segment 'sell all the goods' uses the plural verb 'sell', which does not agree with the singular subject. This is the grammatical error.
